intro: Gynoxys hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in small inflorescences. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical environments, often found in shaded, moist habitats.
